raw_json.html_title: Install JAGS and rjags in Fedora | R-bloggers
raw_json.main_html:
Install JAGS and rjags in Fedora

Posted on January 23, 2009 by Yu-Sung Su in R bloggers | 0 Comments

[This article was first published on Yu-Sung Su's Blog, and kindly contributed to R-bloggers]. (You can report issue about the content on this page here)
Want to share your content on R-bloggers? click here if you have a blog, or here if you don't.

JAGS was developed to help those non-Window users to be able to use BUGS. However, I found it is very hard to install JAGS and its R package-rjags. Here is my note on how to install JAGS and rjags in Fedora 10. The note here should work for all Linux systems.Compile JAGS1. Download JAGS source code from JAGS website into any folder. The file you are looking for should look like this JAGS-1.0.3

Related

To leave a comment for the author, please follow the link and comment on their blog: Yu-Sung Su's Blog.
R-bloggers.com offers daily e-mail updates about R news and tutorials about learning R and many other topics. Click here if you're looking to post or find an R/data-science job.
